Conclusions

As summary of this descriptive analysis, we may say: - Districts with the schools in the suburb are prevailed. - At the first sight, there is no correlation between the percentage of black/hispanic students, the perctntage of students with free or reduced cost lunches, the speed of Internet. Of course, I might wrong. Such kind of analysis demands more data. - The distribution of expenditure is about 2,5 times. The leader is the District of Columbia, and Florida has the least expenditure. - SDO (School & District Operations) products have more engagements. - The corporate sector has the least number of products and the best engagement index and vice versa for PreK-12. - The most popular products are LMS. - The most active states are: Arizona, North Dakota, New York, New Hampshire, District Of Columbia. - After an emergency of COVID-19 starts, an engagement grows especially after the summer holidays. - After schools closing, an online engagement grows.

Introduction

This notebook is dedicated to the analysis of LearnPlatform and how COVID 19 impacts digital learning.

I decided to split analysis on three parts.

  • Districts and states. Distribution on types of locale. Percentage of black and hispanic students in each state. Etc.
  • Products statistics. Distribution on sectors and categories.
  • Changing engagements on LearnPlatform during COVID 19. I'm going to show how to change the engagement index during 2020 and find out if there is dependence on COVID 19 events or not

There'll be data visualization in each part. Based on it I'll try to make conclusions.
